word: Mind Takes Level of Things It Observes.--The understanding takes the level of the things with which it becomes familiar. If all would make the Bible [SEE CHAPTER 11, "BIBLE STUDY AND THE MIND."] their study, we should see a people further developed, capable of thinking more deeply, and showing a greater degree of intelligence than the most earnest efforts in studying merely the sciences and histories of the world could make them. The Bible gives the true seeker an advanced mental discipline, and he comes from contemplation of divine things with his faculties enriched; self is humbled, while God and His revealed truth are exalted.-- RH, Aug 21, 1888. (FE 130.)
